neighbors.name: Jason Brenden
neighbors.claims: Jason Brenden grew up in Cherry Valley as one of two sons of Steven Brenden, a longtime local who worked 36 years at the Chrysler plant in nearby Belvidere [Fitzgerald Funeral Home](https://www.fitzgeraldfh.com/obituaries/steven-lowell-brenden). The Brenden family has lived in Cherry Valley since the late 1960s and is not known for public civic roles [Fitzgerald Funeral Home](https://www.fitzgeraldfh.com/obituaries/steven-lowell-brenden).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Jason through a respectful one-on-one conversation that acknowledges his family’s long history in the area. Emphasize listening to any concerns and building trust over shared community values.

neighbors.name: David C. Stokstad
neighbors.claims: David C. Stokstad appears to be a private landowner in the Cherry Valley area with no readily visible civic or public profile in local records [Rockford Register Star](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/rrstar/name/susan-smith-gable-obituary?id=17653966). No news articles or meeting minutes were found that mention him, suggesting he stays out of public community affairs [Rockford Register Star](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/rrstar/name/susan-smith-gable-obituary?id=17653966).

approach_recommendations.engage: Since Mr. Stokstad’s views are not publicly known, an initial step would be a neighborly outreach to introduce the project and invite his feedback. Having a neutral community liaison make contact could encourage him to share any concerns in a low-pressure setting.

neighbors.name: James A. & Synda C. Gable
neighbors.claims: James and Synda Gable are a local husband-and-wife landowning couple and part of a multi-generational Cherry Valley family [Rockford Register Star](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/rrstar/name/susan-smith-gable-obituary?id=17653966). They reside in Cherry Valley near other members of the Gable family, but neither holds a public office or is documented as participating in local government meetings [Rockford Register Star](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/rrstar/name/susan-smith-gable-obituary?id=17653966).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach the Gables through personal connections – for example, via a neighbor or local farmer they know – and acknowledge their family’s long-standing ties to the community. Emphasize common interests in preserving the area’s character when discussing any development plans.

neighbors.name: Charles Scott Layng
neighbors.claims: Charles Scott Layng is connected to a pioneer family that has lived in the Cherry Valley area since at least the 1860s [Layng Family – Rootie](https://rootie.org/layng-family/). The Layng family’s longstanding presence in Winnebago County is documented in local genealogical records, though Charles himself has kept a low public profile with no recent mentions in local news or civic activities [Layng Family – Rootie](https://rootie.org/layng-family/).

approach_recommendations.engage: When engaging Mr. Layng, it may help to highlight respect for his family’s deep roots in the community. Reaching out via a long-time local resident or mutual acquaintance could facilitate a constructive dialogue, given the family’s heritage in the area.

neighbors.name: Ward H. Gable
neighbors.claims: Ward H. Gable is the patriarch of the Gable family in Cherry Valley and has been a resident landowner in the area for decades [Rockford Register Star](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/rrstar/name/susan-smith-gable-obituary?id=17653966). Now a senior citizen, Ward’s household and grown children (including James Gable) all reside locally, reflecting the family’s long-standing local presence [Rockford Register Star](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/rrstar/name/susan-smith-gable-obituary?id=17653966).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected community member who knows the farming community approach Ward Gable, given his standing as a long-time local landowner. Emphasize that any development plans will consider and respect the Gable family’s legacy and the community’s agricultural heritage.

neighbors.name: James R. Petersen & Mary E. Petersen
neighbors.claims: James R. Petersen (born 1955) is about 70 years old and co-owns a residential parcel in Cherry Valley with his wife Mary E. Petersen ([www.menstoppingviolence.org](https://www.menstoppingviolence.org/people/james-petersen/#:~:text=James%20Petersen%20was%20born%20on,The)). The Petersens have no record of public participation in local land-use debates and did not appear among neighbors who spoke on recent solar farm proposals ([chronicleillinois.com](https://chronicleillinois.com/uncategorized/winnebago-turns-down-solar-farm-plan/#:~:text=Tate%20Road%20neighbors%20Rebecca%20Bussan%2C,their%20opposition%20to%20the%20project)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out to the Petersens in person and early, focusing on building trust. Listen to any personal concerns they have about their property and reassure them the project will respect the community’s rural character.

neighbors.name: Michael J. Combs & Jody R. Combs
neighbors.claims: Michael J. Combs and Jody R. Combs jointly own a Cherry Valley property, but they hold no known positions in local government or community organizations ([chronicleillinois.com](https://chronicleillinois.com/uncategorized/winnebago-turns-down-solar-farm-plan/#:~:text=Tate%20Road%20neighbors%20Rebecca%20Bussan%2C,their%20opposition%20to%20the%20project)). They have not been publicly cited taking any side on area development or clean energy projects, and their names do not appear in media coverage of recent zoning debates ([chronicleillinois.com](https://chronicleillinois.com/uncategorized/winnebago-turns-down-solar-farm-plan/#:~:text=Tate%20Road%20neighbors%20Rebecca%20Bussan%2C,their%20opposition%20to%20the%20project)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach the Combs family privately through a trusted community contact. Emphasize open communication and invite them to share any concerns about how the project might affect their daily life or property.

neighbors.name: Daniel Hana
neighbors.claims: Daniel Hana owns a parcel in Cherry Valley, Winnebago County, but no public information was found linking him to community leadership or activism ([chronicleillinois.com](https://chronicleillinois.com/uncategorized/winnebago-turns-down-solar-farm-plan/#:~:text=Tate%20Road%20neighbors%20Rebecca%20Bussan%2C,their%20opposition%20to%20the%20project)). There are no reports of Hana voicing opinions on local development issues in meeting minutes or news outlets ([chronicleillinois.com](https://chronicleillinois.com/uncategorized/winnebago-turns-down-solar-farm-plan/#:~:text=Tate%20Road%20neighbors%20Rebecca%20Bussan%2C,their%20opposition%20to%20the%20project)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Mr. Hana through a polite introduction at his residence. Provide clear information about the project and assure him that you’re available to answer questions, as he has not previously engaged in public discussions.

neighbors.name: Carlos Serna
neighbors.claims: Carlos Serna is a local real estate professional (Century 21 Affiliated) serving the Cherry Valley/Rockford area ([www.redfin.com](https://www.redfin.com/real-estate-agents/carlos-serna#:~:text=Brokerage%3A)). He has closed over 260 home sales in the region, indicating a broad network in the community ([www.redfin.com](https://www.redfin.com/real-estate-agents/carlos-serna#:~:text=Brokerage%3A)). Serna has not made any public statements opposing development; no records show him participating in recent anti-development efforts ([chronicleillinois.com](https://chronicleillinois.com/uncategorized/winnebago-turns-down-solar-farm-plan/#:~:text=Tate%20Road%20neighbors%20Rebecca%20Bussan%2C,their%20opposition%20to%20the%20project)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a conversation with Mr. Serna via a mutual business acquaintance or local realtor network. Highlight how the project can coexist with property values and contribute to the area’s economic growth, aligning with interests a real estate professional would appreciate.

neighbors.name: Lisa Gable
neighbors.claims: Lisa Gable resides in Cherry Valley, and public records show she is part of a local family (spouse James Gable, age 57) that has lived in the area for years ([besthistorysites.net](https://besthistorysites.net/name/james-gable#:~:text=James%20Gable%20is%20a%20fifty,email%20addresses%20for%20James%20Gable)). She holds no public office or committee membership, and her name is absent from local news on development or planning disputes ([chronicleillinois.com](https://chronicleillinois.com/uncategorized/winnebago-turns-down-solar-farm-plan/#:~:text=Tate%20Road%20neighbors%20Rebecca%20Bussan%2C,their%20opposition%20to%20the%20project)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Mrs. Gable through a neighborly visit with a community liaison. Emphasize respect for the community’s heritage and listen to any questions, noting that as long-term residents they may value assurances about preserving the area’s character.

neighbors.name: Daniel & Jessica Levy
neighbors.claims: Daniel and Jessica Levy own a parcel in Cherry Valley but have not been publicly active in local development discussions ([chicagocitywire.com](https://chicagocitywire.com/stories/666238361-village-of-cherry-valley-board-of-trustees-met-nov-4#:~:text=PUBLIC%20COMMENT%3A%20None)). They hold no public office or formal civic roles in the community ([www.crfhost.com](https://www.crfhost.com/cv/index.php/contact-us#:~:text=David%20Schroeder%20%20,1241)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out with project information and invite their questions in a neighborly, low-key meeting.

Belcher is a Cherry Valley resident; 2020 records show a Belcher household on West State Street in the village ([rockfordsun.com](https://rockfordsun.com/stories/656813462-examining-2020-presidential-election-voter-turnout-in-central-e-village-of-cherry-valley-precinct-cherry-valley-1#:~:text=Chenoa%20Jo%20Belcher%20%20,Voted)). neighbors.name: David Reyes
neighbors.claims: David Reyes owns a neighboring parcel (PIN 12-36-351-003) but has not made any public statements about local projects ([chicagocitywire.com](https://chicagocitywire.com/stories/666238361-village-of-cherry-valley-board-of-trustees-met-nov-4#:~:text=PUBLIC%20COMMENT%3A%20None)). neighbors.name: Sharon K. Seebruck
neighbors.claims: Sharon Seebruck married Leon F. Seebruck in 1993; Leon was a construction company owner who worked across the U.S. [Fitzgerald Funeral Home](https://www.fitzgeraldfh.com/obituaries/leon-f-seebruck). Leon passed away in 2020 at their Cherry Valley home ([www.fitzgeraldfh.com](https://www.fitzgeraldfh.com/obituaries/leon-f-seebruck#:~:text=Leon%20F,Patrick%20Silverman)). No meeting minutes or local news records mention Sharon taking any public position on area development [Chicago City Wire](https://chicagocitywire.com/stories/666238361-village-of-cherry-valley-board-of-trustees-met-nov-4).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage her in a personal, respectful conversation through a trusted community member, acknowledging her late husband’s local building work to build rapport and address any concerns.

neighbors.name: Jose H. Cruz
neighbors.claims: Jose H. Cruz owns property in the Cherry Valley area, but he has not been identified in any local government proceedings or community leadership positions ([chicagocitywire.com](https://chicagocitywire.com/stories/666238361-village-of-cherry-valley-board-of-trustees-met-nov-4#:~:text=No%20,cruz)). His name does not appear in recent village board reports or local media, suggesting he has not publicly engaged on development issues [Chicago City Wire](https://chicagocitywire.com/stories/666238361-village-of-cherry-valley-board-of-trustees-met-nov-4).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach one-on-one (with bilingual communication if needed), focusing on listening to any concerns and emphasizing that the project will respect his property and daily life.

neighbors.name: Michael G. Grenke
neighbors.claims: Michael G. Grenke is a landowner in Cherry Valley with no public-facing roles or statements on record ([rockfordsun.com](https://rockfordsun.com/stories/656806565-review-of-2020-presidential-election-voting-trends-in-central-township-of-cherry-valley-precinct-cherry-valley-11#:~:text=No%20,grenke)). approach_recommendations.engage: Have a personalized outreach by a project representative or mutual acquaintance to introduce the plans and invite his feedback, since he has stayed out of the public eye.

neighbors.name: Austin Pittman
neighbors.claims: Austin Pittman owns property in the vicinity, but he holds no known official positions and has not voiced any opinions in public forums ([rockfordsun.com](https://rockfordsun.com/stories/656806565-review-of-2020-presidential-election-voting-trends-in-central-township-of-cherry-valley-precinct-cherry-valley-11#:~:text=No%20,pittman)). His absence from local meeting reports or civic activities indicates he has remained a private community member [Chicago City Wire](https://chicagocitywire.com/stories/666238361-village-of-cherry-valley-board-of-trustees-met-nov-4).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out informally (e.g., via a neighborhood meet-and-greet or a personal visit) to explain the project and encourage questions, given that he has not been publicly involved.

neighbors.name: Mary J. & Dale W. Moyer
neighbors.claims: Mary J. and Dale W. Moyer jointly own a parcel in the Cherry Valley area, and they are not recorded as serving on any local boards or committees ([rockfordsun.com](https://rockfordsun.com/stories/656806565-review-of-2020-presidential-election-voting-trends-in-central-township-of-cherry-valley-precinct-cherry-valley-11#:~:text=No%20,moyer)). approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Moyers through a neighbor or community figure they respect. Emphasize how the project will be managed to protect the rural character and address any legacy or land stewardship concerns they may have.

neighbors.name: Lisa A. Heinzeroth
neighbors.claims: Lisa A. Heinzeroth is a Cherry Valley resident who cast a ballot in the 2020 presidential election [Rockford Sun](https://rockfordsun.com/stories/656813462-examining-2020-presidential-election-voter-turnout-in-central-e-village-of-cherry-valley-precinct-cherry-valley-1). She has no record of holding public office or voicing opinions on development in local meetings as of late 2024 [Chicago City Wire](https://chicagocitywire.com/stories/666238361-village-of-cherry-valley-board-of-trustees-met-nov-4).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use friendly, direct outreach to share information one-on-one and invite her to discuss any questions or concerns about the project.

neighbors.claims: Richard A. and Janna M. McLaughlin reside together in Cherry Valley and both voted in the 2020 general election [Rockford Sun](https://rockfordsun.com/stories/656813462-examining-2020-presidential-election-voter-turnout-in-central-e-village-of-cherry-valley-precinct-cherry-valley-1). Neither has been publicly involved in local government or development debates as of 2024 [Chicago City Wire](https://chicagocitywire.com/stories/666238361-village-of-cherry-valley-board-of-trustees-met-nov-4).

neighbors.claims: Vicki A. Ross lives in Cherry Valley; she did not cast a ballot in the 2020 presidential election [Rockford Sun](https://rockfordsun.com/stories/656813462-examining-2020-presidential-election-voter-turnout-in-central-e-village-of-cherry-valley-precinct-cherry-valley-1). There is no indication that she has participated in local civic discussions or projects in recent years [Chicago City Wire](https://chicagocitywire.com/stories/666238361-village-of-cherry-valley-board-of-trustees-met-nov-4).

approach_recommendations.engage: Provide her with clear, accessible project information and follow up with a personal visit to invite questions, as she may not be actively engaged in community forums.

neighbors.claims: Jan D. Goranson is a Cherry Valley property owner on Sha Lane who voted in the 2020 presidential election [Rockford Sun](https://rockfordsun.com/stories/656813462-examining-2020-presidential-election-voter-turnout-in-central-e-village-of-cherry-valley-precinct-cherry-valley-1). approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with a neighborly conversation to understand his viewpoint, emphasizing how the development will address common resident interests (e.g., property values or traffic) and inviting his feedback.

neighbors.name: Jane E. Pettersen
neighbors.claims: Jane E. Pettersen resides in Cherry Valley and was an active voter in the 2020 general election [Rockford Sun](https://rockfordsun.com/stories/656813462-examining-2020-presidential-election-voter-turnout-in-central-e-village-of-cherry-valley-precinct-cherry-valley-1). She has no known involvement in local governmental proceedings or community advocacy concerning development issues [Chicago City Wire](https://chicagocitywire.com/stories/666238361-village-of-cherry-valley-board-of-trustees-met-nov-4).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage her with a friendly invitation to a small informational meeting or open house, ensuring her questions are answered and highlighting aspects of the project that align with general community well-being.

neighbors.name: C V Spiritualist Camp Inc
neighbors.claims: C V Spiritualist Camp Inc is a religious nonprofit in Cherry Valley, IL established in 1947 [Cause IQ](https://www.causeiq.com/organizations/national-spiritual-association-of-churches,366131548/). Also known as the Cherry Valley Spiritualist Camp Association, it operates the Christabelle Spiritualist Church at 8002 Service Road, which has been at that site since 1925 [Rock Valley Publishing](https://rvpnews.com/local-spiritualist-church-is-one-of-a-few-in-illinois/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Historic small church community; limited financial resources or political influence

approach_recommendations.engage: Meet with the camp’s board or pastor to address concerns; emphasize the project will not disturb their peaceful retreat and may respect their community values.

neighbors.name: Voicestream Gsm I Operating Co Llc
neighbors.claims: Voicestream GSM I Operating Co., LLC is a telecommunications entity that operates under the T-Mobile brand to provide wireless services; it holds a cell tower asset in Cherry Valley but has no local community presence [Justia](https://law.justia.com/cases/louisiana/supreme-court/2006/05ca2578-1.html).
neighbors.influence_justification: Large telecom owner with only infrastructure presence; no local stakeholder engagement

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with T-Mobile’s network engineering team to ensure the project does not impact their tower; otherwise minimal engagement needed due to their lack of local involvement.

neighbors.claims: See RESIDENT table.

approach_recommendations.engage: N/A

neighbors.name: Velez & Munoz Enterprise Llc
neighbors.claims: Velez & Munoz Enterprise LLC is a Florida-registered company formed on May 11, 2022, with its principal office in Miami, FL and a mailing address in Rockford, IL [BizProfile](https://www.bizprofile.net/fl/miami/velez-munoz-enterprise-llc). The company’s principals are listed as Gicela Muñoz and German Velez, both providing addresses in Medellín, Colombia [BizProfile](https://www.bizprofile.net/fl/miami/velez-munoz-enterprise-llc).
neighbors.influence_justification: Out-of-area investors; no local ties or political connections

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact their Rockford-based representative or agent; offer a profitable buyout or partnership opportunity aligned with their investment objectives.

overview_summary: None of the five profiled neighbors have an explicitly documented stance on development, leaving their positions unknown. Likewise, no neighbor holds an obvious leadership role in the community; all are private landowners with relatively low public profiles and informal influence. None of these five Cherry Valley landowners have taken a documented public stance on the proposed development – all are classified with an “unknown” stance. Most appear to have low community influence with no formal civic roles; only one neighbor (a local realtor) is assessed with medium influence due to wide professional connections. None of the profiled neighbors have made their position on the development publicly known (all are categorized as "unknown" stance). Likewise, none hold any notable local offices or influence (no high-influence neighbors identified). None of the five profiled neighbors have made public statements supporting or opposing development, leaving all of their stances classified as unknown. Likewise, none hold prominent positions in local government or civic organizations, so there are no high-influence neighbors in this group; all are low-profile community members. None of these five Cherry Valley neighbors has a documented stance for or against new development; all are classified as "unknown" in the absence of public statements. They are private residents with generally low community influence, as none hold public office or prominent leadership roles. The neighboring owners include two family trusts (see resident profiles) and three organizations: a small religious camp, a telecom tower holding, and a recent land investment LLC. The spiritualist camp is long-established but has limited influence beyond preserving its peaceful retreat, while the telecom owner (T-Mobile) is purely infrastructural with no local involvement. The Florida-based Velez & Munoz LLC appears to be a speculative investor driven by land value rather than community ties. None of these neighbors is likely to lead major opposition, though the church camp might voice concerns about tranquility.
